stories.text: I used to browse around Medium when it was free. Now I find myself gravitating towards tech oriented sites like HackerNews. I miss reading broader content, like self improvement, professional development, history, culture, etc. Any suggestions for a place where I can casually read stuff like that?
stories.title: Ask HN: What do you read for general knowledge?
What does 'jsii' stand for? (AWS transpiler project)
The Agenda of Google's Manifest V3 Update

stories.text:
Airbnb offers amazing cancellation. I just booked a place for late June of 2022, with cancellation up to 48h before check-in. I've even seen places with cancellation up to 24h before check-in.

Why, then, do bots not go book these places systematically and attempt to re-sell them? Or just book to troll Airbnb (and maybe profit some other way—maybe if you are a host you can "book" all the places near you creating artificial demand).

Since this happens all the time (Xboxes, PS5, graphics cards for mining), why is this not more widespread with Airbnb?

Even with the 1/2 payment due at time of booking, the returns on such a nefarious scheme should easily justify the cost of capital.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why last-minute cancellation Airbnbs not booked ("held ransom") by bots?
Establishing Fast, Bidirectional Communication into Air-Gapped Systems
Adventures of putting 16 GB RAM in a motherboard that doesn’t support it (2019)
ACLU: “The prosecution of Julian Assange poses a grave threat to press freedom.”

stories.text:
Curious to know what your favorite book you read in 2021 was?

I enjoyed reading the Almanac of Naval. It was great as a summary of ideas to think about. The reading list in the back had some interesting suggestions.
stories.title: Ask HN: Favorite Book in 2021?
